title: Lag / Packet loss
body: SO, about 3 days ago (the first day of LCS)  my league started to lag  (ms +50)  and I stated getting a lot of packet losses. I created a ticket and did everything they told me to do ( I disabled teredo , disabled ipv6 and switched to public DNS. I even called my internet provider to see if they had any kind of problem, but nothing... )  So here I am with up to 150 ms (before it was like 70 max ) without any help. I live in Georgia and when I asked my friend (who also lives in my town )if he had a little bit more lag than usual,he responded positively. So I am not sure what happened but I would appreciate any kind of suggestions and help from you my friends. Thanks a lot in advance :)

replies.body:
In Arlington TX, was getting a steady 35 ms ping and 0 - .1% packet loss before a coulpe weeks ago (spectrum internet wired connection)

Now every game i play has results like this

Avg Latency	52.66 ms
Avg Packet Loss	4.64%
Avg Jitter	12.31 ms

Huge packet loss spikes and ping fluctuation

Are you on ethernet or wifi? Also, have you checked lagreport.com to see if there have been any recent changes in the quality of your connection? Packet-loss will cause the ping shown in-game to spike, so that's the first place I'd look.
I'm having similar issues as well. They are having me run a bunch of test and nothing has fixed it.
